com.zberman2.Game

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zberman2.Game.GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which describes the functionality of the Graphical User Interface (for now, the GUI is static) Creates an 8x8 chessboard, outlined with rank and file labels Referenced http://stackoverflow.com/questions/21077322/create-a-chess-board-with-jpanel to get started on this GUI design. The only function below actually taken from stackoverflow.com is createImages(), everything else is my code, and my refactoring done to make everything easy to read

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUI(Board board)
      Constructs the gui by setting the board object, and calling the drawBoard entry method

        public void resetBackgrounds()
        Initially called to the set the background colors on the board Subsequent calls will be used to reset the colors after certain spaces are highlighted (indicating legal moves)

      • resetToolbar

        public void resetToolbar()
        Method used to reset the toolbar after the game by enable the standard and alternate game buttons, and disabling everything else

      • refreshBoard

        public void refreshBoard()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        After a move takes place, this method is called to update the board. It sets the icons of spaces with pieces with their image, and sets the icons of spaces without pieces to null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Returns:

      • getSpaceAt

        public javax.swing.JButton getSpaceAt(char file,
                                      int rank)
        Getter for a particular space within the 2D array of JButtons, chessboardSpaces
        Parameters:
        file - the character corresponding to the file on the board
        rank - the integer corresponding to the rank on the board
        Returns:
        the JButton at that (file, rank) coordinate

      • rankIndex

        public int rankIndex(int rank)
        Converts a rank on the board to its index within the 2D array of JButtons defining the spaces
        Parameters:
        rank - The number corresponding the rank on the board
        Returns:
        the index of that rank in chessBoardSpaces

        Returns:
